intro: Ruellia cumingiana, commonly known as the Cuming's ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically blue to violet in color, attracting various pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Ruellia cumingiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
